Description: Incense burner; spherical, made in two halves; the top and base have roundel of interlaced palmettes with thick stems. Body of cartouches of similar interlace and knotted pseudo-Kufic separated by roundels of palmettes and arabesques. Made of cast brass, pierced, engraved and inlaid with silver and a black substance.
Bibliographic references: Ward 1990/91 / Incense and incense burners in Mamluk Egypt and Syria (p.77, pl.14)
La Niece, Ward et al 1995 / Veneto-Saracenic metalwork: an analysis of the bowls and incense burners in the British Museum
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2012-2013 24 Nov-13 Jan, Indianapolis Museum of Art, Beauty and Belief 2012 24 Feb-29 Sep, Provo, Brigham Young University Museum of Art, Beauty and Belief
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir Augustus Wollaston Franks
